intro: Tofieldia furusei, commonly known as the Japanese sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wetlands. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, with a distinct three-sided stem. Tofieldia furusei produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family.
